instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
small water damage near ssd rail.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> was short, i was fix it.
no other short.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.2V
LDO reading o.k.
L9080/20/30 O.k.
no detected DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
What did you find bad on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
Check AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> LDOs.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
Do you get 3.3V at pin 2/<RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR>?
If yes, then bad PMU, or broken trace/solder.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 89572, member: 682"]
Do you get 3.3V at pin 2/<RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR>?
[/QUOTE]
no its 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
So, do you still think <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> is good?
You've said to have 3.3V at pin 1:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> was short, [B][U]i was fix it[/U][/B]"
Did you check <RESISTOR>R6934</RESISTOR>/35?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
i was fixed the short but didnt get the 3V
replace <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
"Did you check <RESISTOR>R6934</RESISTOR>/35?"
Shorted <CAPACITOR>C9500</CAPACITOR>, supposedly burnt them...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message: they are o.k i was replaced them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
So <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> wasn't fixed; be more clear next time, on the mentions.

Does <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> get VIN and EN?
Check <RESISTOR>R6970</RESISTOR>/1/2/6 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message: If all traces and surrounding components are good, then change <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>.
